item.title: [Allstar]New, better dialogue system! || Try it!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:32, topic:508747”][quote author=matzie link=topic=626987.msg4311188#msg4311188 date=1370755536]

lol @copyright? you mean to tell me that you copyrighted some illegal material that we are all a part of? at least they know where to find you.
So if i am to check the copyright office database your class file will be there? lol.

Actually, this being a server sided tutorial plus the fact that he uses hyperion makes his server 100% legal. The only illegal parts of any server are Cryption and Stream cause they are both ripped from the client. Graham wrote everything in hyperion, and I mean everything. He wrote his own implementation of ISAAC and his own buffer, replacing the two illegal classes.

still, if you write something with the other source in mind, it is still copyright infringement. look it up O_o’
[/quote]you, my friend, are confusing yourself with plagiarism

but still:
user a designs a program, includes a well designed, efficient class for handling all streams/buffers and the like. decides to copyright said program and all code included.

user b sees this program, reverse engineers and see’s this efficient but copyrighted class, and decided to use it as a reference to create another efficient class, with a separate design. user b then decides to release the said class as open source, with appropriate licensing.

this is exactly what happened with Cyption>>ISAACCipher and Stream>>StreamBuffer[/quote]
hate that word O_O

Read full topic

Actually, this being a server sided tutorial plus the fact that he uses hyperion makes his server 100% legal. The only illegal parts of any server are Cryption and Stream cause they are both ripped from the client. Graham wrote everything in hyperion, and I mean everything. He wrote his own implementation of ISAAC and his own buffer, replacing the two illegal classes.
[/quote]

still, if you write something with the other source in mind, it is still copyright infringement. look it up O_o’[/quote]you, my friend, are confusing yourself with plagiarism

but still:
user a designs a program, includes a well designed, efficient class for handling all streams/buffers and the like. decides to copyright said program and all code included.

user b sees this program, reverse engineers and see’s this efficient but copyrighted class, and decided to use it as a reference to create another efficient class, with a separate design. user b then decides to release the said class as open source, with appropriate licensing.

this is exactly what happened with Cyption>>ISAACCipher and Stream>>StreamBuffer

item.title: [Allstar]New, better dialogue system! || Try it!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Uncalled:

I’m glad that someone finally knows how to write a tutorial. I’ve always had the patience to try and make a great tutorial whenever I write one, which isn’t often, and I’m very glad to see that you do as well. I hate to come in and see a bit of code and where to place it as a “tutorial”. All the tutorials I’ve seen you make are well designed. Thank you for that.

Thanks alot man

[quote=“DAn0194, post:28, topic:508747”]Great Dialogue system, I decided to use it and its good so far.

Good job :)[/quote]
You too.

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]New, better dialogue system! || Try it!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Kamran1, post:25, topic:508747”]Posting for a friend who asked me to post this on skype;

He’s added this, there are no errors, however there is no dialogue if he tries to speak to any NPC, he’s changed the Case NPCID around a bit, and still does not work for him,
He says dialogue worked for a few npc’s before he done this tutorial, so he thinks he has removed the talk-to npcdialogue system while doing this tutorial.

Thanks[/quote]
I am not sure as to what lead to this problem.

Jayden.:

Sick tutorial, Arham.

Thanks man, second dialogue system so it may be crappy.

Host Gushers:

Like usual… GOOD JOB BRO <3

Hehe, thanks.

[quote=“matzie, post:23, topic:508747”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=626987.msg4262250#msg4262250 date=1363570601]

lol @copyright? you mean to tell me that you copyrighted some illegal material that we are all a part of? at least they know where to find you.
So if i am to check the copyright office database your class file will be there? lol.

Actually, this being a server sided tutorial plus the fact that he uses hyperion makes his server 100% legal. The only illegal parts of any server are Cryption and Stream cause they are both ripped from the client. Graham wrote everything in hyperion, and I mean everything. He wrote his own implementation of ISAAC and his own buffer, replacing the two illegal classes.
[/quote]
sources cites vs sources referenced.
if you were using the client (coded by rs, originally) as a reference for coding the server. I am still correct. or did he write a client, and then server that would read his client? i doubt he “magically knew” that the correct packet handling (: and the one with the only legitimate copyright- is jagSux. [/quote]
Ain’t getting into this conversation.

Bump.

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]New, better dialogue system! || Try it!
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:18, topic:508747”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=626987.msg4263230#msg4263230 date=1363653699]
My question was rhetorical.

Servers are not illegal, which classes are you saying are ‘ripped’ from JaGex?
[/quote]
Cryption and Stream, only present in most, if not all winterlove releases.[/quote]

What “Cryption”?

Stream would only be used in winterlove bases…Also there’s no copyright there, since just because I do something doesn’t mean someone else can’t have something similar…

Anyway, most (if not all) new frameworks (mine being included) use there own ‘Stream’ class.

[quote=“Jmood, post:19, topic:508747”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=626987.msg4263302#msg4263302 date=1363661871]

My question was rhetorical.

Servers are not illegal, which classes are you saying are ‘ripped’ from JaGex?

Cryption and Stream, only present in most, if not all winterlove releases.
[/quote]

I must also add iirc the protocol is most likely under copyright.[/quote]

No…It’s not…Don’t see how it would be anyway.

Let’s just put it like this: Servers are 100% legal.

Not like it matters anyway, since you’ll be using the client along with the server…

Read full topic
